item1.title1: Bhagavad Gita quotes by Shree Krishna
item1.content: Feelings of heat and cold, pleasure and pain, are caused by the contact of the senses with their objects. They come and they go, never lasting long. You must accept them.

verses.translation: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, assembled in the sacred land of Kurukshetra and desiring to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?
verses.commentary: The Bhagavad Gita begins with King Dhritarashtra inquiring about the battle that was to take place between his sons (Kauravas) and the sons of Pandu (Pandavas) in the holy field of Kurukshetra.

verses.translation: Sanjaya said: Seeing the Pandava army arranged in military formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher Drona and spoke these words:
verses.commentary: The eldest Kaurava, Duryodhana, sees the well-arranged Pandava army and immediately consults his teacher Dronacharya.

verses.translation: Sanjaya said: Seeing Arjuna overwhelmed with compassion and despair, his eyes filled with tears, Madhusudana (Krishna) spoke the following words.
verses.commentary: This verse marks the beginning of Lord Krishna‚Äôs teachings.

verses.translation: The Lord said: O Arjuna, how has this delusion come upon you at this hour of crisis?
verses.commentary: Lord Krishna rebukes Arjuna for his weakness.

verses.translation: I praise Agni, the priest of the sacrifice.
verses.commentary: The first sukta of Rigveda, dedicated to the deity Agni.

verses.translation: Agni, praised by both ancient and modern sages.
verses.commentary: Agni is timeless and revered by all generations of sages.
